text: Hello Ida, sorry for the late response, I my notifications on here don't always work so I miss a lot of messages.

I started as a graphic designer, so was not always into VFX. I worked at Sky in their graphics and motion graphics teams and didn't really know much aobut VFX at all. The VFX department next to ours and so that's how I found out about it and when they had an opening for a junior compositor, I thought it would be interesting to try. I saw the cool work coming out of the department and wanted to be apart of it. I had not even heard of Nuke, so in short, no i didn't always want to work in VFX but I enjoyed it once I was doing it

I terms of the director, I don't really work closely with them. Once we finish our shots, it gets get to the client who presents it to the director. We then get feedback notes from him/her so there is rarely direct communication. They may pop into the office now and again however, would generally deal with the owners of the company rather than the artists
